p: Few studies appraised the anti-inflammatory potential of S.Â media in animals. Till date, only the in vitro appraisal of crude or purified fractions was reported. The inflammatory effect of methanolic leaf extract (MLE) was investigated on test rats of different body weights (100 mg/kg, 300 mg/kg and 500 mg/kg). Pronounced reduction in inflammation was exhibited on formalin-induced paw lick and albumen induced paw oedema after oral administration of MLE, indomethacin (5 mg/kg b.w) and distilled water (10 mg/kg b.w). Also, MLE considerably inhibited egg albumen-induced paw oedema at p < 0.05 [ 30].
